text:
Frank Joseph Lucchesi (April 24, 1927 – June 8, 2019) was an American professional baseball player, manager, and coach. He was the manager of three Major League Baseball (MLB) teams: the Philadelphia Phillies (1970–1972), Texas Rangers (1975–1977), and Chicago Cubs (1987). Lucchesi was born in San Francisco, California.
On June 8, 2019, Lucchesi died in Colleyville, Texas at the age of 92.
